00041 #ifndef __UDT_BUFFER_H__

00045 #include "udt.h"
00046 #include "list.h"
00047 #include "queue.h"

00049 
00050 class CSndBuffer
00051 {
00052 public:
00053    CSndBuffer(const int& size, const int& mss);
00054    ~CSndBuffer();
00055 
00056       // Functionality:
00057       //    Insert a user buffer into the sending list.
00058       // Parameters:
00059       //    0) [in] data: pointer to the user data block.
00060       //    1) [in] len: size of the block.
00061       //    2) [in] ttl: time to live in milliseconds
00062       //    3) [in] order: if the block should be delivered in order, for DGRAM only
00063       // Returned value:
00064       //    None.
00065 
00066    void addBuffer(const char* data, const int& len, const int& ttl = -1, const bool& order = false);
00067 
00068       // Functionality:
00069       //    Read a block of data from file and insert it into the sending list.
00070       // Parameters:
00071       //    0) [in] ifs: input file stream.
00072       //    1) [in] len: size of the block.
00073       // Returned value:
00074       //    actual size of data added from the file.
00075 
00076    int addBufferFromFile(std::fstream& ifs, const int& len);
00077 
00078       // Functionality:
00079       //    Find data position to pack a DATA packet from the furthest reading point.
00080       // Parameters:
00081       //    0) [out] data: the pointer to the data position.
00082       //    1) [out] msgno: message number of the packet.
00083       // Returned value:
00084       //    Actual length of data read.
00085 
00086    int readData(char** data, int32_t& msgno);
00087 
00088       // Functionality:
00089       //    Find data position to pack a DATA packet for a retransmission.
00090       // Parameters:
00091       //    0) [out] data: the pointer to the data position.
00092       //    1) [in] offset: offset from the last ACK point.
00093       //    2) [out] msgno: message number of the packet.
00094       //    3) [out] msglen: length of the message
00095       // Returned value:
00096       //    Actual length of data read.
00097 
00098    int readData(char** data, const int offset, int32_t& msgno, int& msglen);
00099 
00100       // Functionality:
00101       //    Update the ACK point and may release/unmap/return the user data according to the flag.
00102       // Parameters:
00103       //    0) [in] offset: number of packets acknowledged.
00104       // Returned value:
00105       //    None.
00106 
00107    void ackData(const int& offset);
00108 
00109       // Functionality:
00110       //    Read size of data still in the sending list.
00111       // Parameters:
00112       //    None.
00113       // Returned value:
00114       //    Current size of the data in the sending list.
00115 
00116    int getCurrBufSize() const;
00117 
00118 private:
00119    void increase();
00120 
00121 private:
00122    pthread_mutex_t m_BufLock;           // used to synchronize buffer operation
00123 
00124    struct Block
00125    {
00126       char* m_pcData;                   // pointer to the data block
00127       int m_iLength;                    // length of the block
00128 
00129       int32_t m_iMsgNo;                 // message number
00130       uint64_t m_OriginTime;            // original request time
00131       int m_iTTL;                       // time to live (milliseconds)
00132 
00133       Block* m_pNext;                   // next block
00134    } *m_pBlock, *m_pFirstBlock, *m_pCurrBlock, *m_pLastBlock;
00135 
00136    // m_pBlock:         The head pointer
00137    // m_pFirstBlock:    The first block
00138    // m_pCurrBlock:     The current block
00139    // m_pLastBlock:     The last block (if first == last, buffer is empty)
00140 
00141    struct Buffer
00142    {
00143       char* m_pcData;                   // buffer
00144       int m_iSize;                      // size
00145       Buffer* m_pNext;                  // next buffer
00146    } *m_pBuffer;                        // physical buffer
00147 
00148    int32_t m_iNextMsgNo;                // next message number
00149 
00150    int m_iSize;                         // buffer size (number of packets)
00151    int m_iMSS;                          // maximum seqment/packet size
00152 
00153    int m_iCount;                        // number of used blocks
00154 
00155 private:
00156    CSndBuffer(const CSndBuffer&);
00157    CSndBuffer& operator=(const CSndBuffer&);
00158 };
00159 
00161 
00162 class CRcvBuffer
00163 {
00164 public:
00165    CRcvBuffer(CUnitQueue* queue);
00166    CRcvBuffer(const int& bufsize, CUnitQueue* queue);
00167    ~CRcvBuffer();
00168 
00169       // Functionality:
00170       //    Write data into the buffer.
00171       // Parameters:
00172       //    0) [in] unit: pointer to a data unit containing new packet
00173       //    1) [in] offset: offset from last ACK point.
00174       // Returned value:
00175       //    0 is success, -1 if data is repeated.
00176 
00177    int addData(CUnit* unit, int offset);
00178 
00179       // Functionality:
00180       //    Read data into a user buffer.
00181       // Parameters:
00182       //    0) [in] data: pointer to user buffer.
00183       //    1) [in] len: length of user buffer.
00184       // Returned value:
00185       //    size of data read.
00186 
00187    int readBuffer(char* data, const int& len);
00188 
00189       // Functionality:
00190       //    Read data directly into file.
00191       // Parameters:
00192       //    0) [in] file: C++ file stream.
00193       //    1) [in] len: expected length of data to write into the file.
00194       // Returned value:
00195       //    size of data read.
00196 
00197    int readBufferToFile(std::fstream& ofs, const int& len);
00198 
00199       // Functionality:
00200       //    Update the ACK point of the buffer.
00201       // Parameters:
00202       //    0) [in] len: size of data to be acknowledged.
00203       // Returned value:
00204       //    1 if a user buffer is fulfilled, otherwise 0.
00205 
00206    void ackData(const int& len);
00207 
00208       // Functionality:
00209       //    Query how many buffer space left for data receiving.
00210       // Parameters:
00211       //    None.
00212       // Returned value:
00213       //    size of available buffer space (including user buffer) for data receiving.
00214 
00215    int getAvailBufSize() const;
00216 
00217       // Functionality:
00218       //    Query how many data has been continuously received (for reading).
00219       // Parameters:
00220       //    None.
00221       // Returned value:
00222       //    size of valid (continous) data for reading.
00223 
00224    int getRcvDataSize() const;
00225 
00226       // Functionality:
00227       //    mark the message to be dropped from the message list.
00228       // Parameters:
00229       //    0) [in] msgno: message nuumer.
00230       // Returned value:
00231       //    None.
00232 
00233    void dropMsg(const int32_t& msgno);
00234 
00235       // Functionality:
00236       //    read a message.
00237       // Parameters:
00238       //    0) [out] data: buffer to write the message into.
00239       //    1) [in] len: size of the buffer.
00240       // Returned value:
00241       //    actuall size of data read.
00242 
00243    int readMsg(char* data, const int& len);
00244 
00245       // Functionality:
00246       //    Query how many messages are available now.
00247       // Parameters:
00248       //    None.
00249       // Returned value:
00250       //    number of messages available for recvmsg.
00251 
00252    int getRcvMsgNum();
00253 
00254 private:
00255    bool scanMsg(int& start, int& end, bool& passack);
00256 
00257 private:
00258    CUnit** m_pUnit;                     // pointer to the protocol buffer
00259    int m_iSize;                         // size of the protocol buffer
00260    CUnitQueue* m_pUnitQueue;            // the shared unit queue
00261 
00262    int m_iStartPos;                     // the head position for I/O (inclusive)
00263    int m_iLastAckPos;                   // the last ACKed position (exclusive)
00264                                         // EMPTY: m_iStartPos = m_iLastAckPos   FULL: m_iStartPos = m_iLastAckPos + 1
00265    int m_iMaxPos;                       // the furthest data position
00266 
00267    int m_iNotch;                        // the starting read point of the first unit
00268 
00269 private:
00270    CRcvBuffer(const CRcvBuffer&);
00271    CRcvBuffer& operator=(const CRcvBuffer&);
00272 };
